page.title: 06Tiverton Market/Shopping
page.content: Tiverton's Market Place is in the centre of town. It is a car park too. The main Market Days are Tuesday and Friday. There has been a market in Tiverton since the 13th Century and it has helpedthe town to grow. Livestock is sometimes bought and sold there but most people go for the ordinary stalls. Stallholders come from all over the West Country to sell food, clothing, gifts etc. Market Days are always busy in town - some country families only ever come into Tiverton on Market Day. There are many other shops in the town centre but a new hypermarket called "PRESTO'S" is likely to change trading in the future. It has recently started business on the western edge of town and smaller shopkeepers say it is taking away their business and keeping people out of the town centre.
